intro: Parosela emphysodes, commonly known as the purple-flowered parosela, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically purple or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shady environments, often found in woodland areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
